titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Time Inc. Harry Harding Files on Corporate Identity
1967-1971
MS 3009-RG 42
titlestmt.author: Holly Deakyne
titlestmt.sponsor: The processing of the Time Inc. Records was made possible by a generous grant from the Henry Luce Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:46:48 -0400.

did.unittitle: Time Inc. Harry Harding Files on Corporate Identity
did.abstract: Corporate executive Harry Harding's files document his work on Time Inc.'s corporate identity, specifically attempting to create a new corporate logo or trademark for use throughout the company.
did.physloc: Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are in English

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Time Inc. hired advertising executive Harry Harding in 1963 in a new corporate executive position reporting to president James Linen. According to his obituary in the New York Times, Harding worked on the development of international editions of magazines.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: This collection is owned by the New-York Historical Society. Although the N-YHS owns this collection as physical property, the donor specifically retains all copyright and all other proprietary rights which may exist. The copyright law of the United States governs the making of photocopies and protects unpublished materials as well as published materials. Unpublished materials created before January 1, 1978 cannot be quoted in publication without permission of the copyright holder.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection are stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials Note
relatedmaterial.p: This finding aid relates to just one record group of the Time Inc. Records. For information about the other record groups and for overall information about the archives, please see the Guide to the Time Inc. Records (MS 3009). The Henry Luce Papers (MS 3014) were acquired with the Time Inc. Records. The collection of books acquired with the records are cataloged as the Time Inc. Reference Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents Note
scopecontent.p: Harry Harding's files document his work on Time Inc.'s corporate identity, specifically attempting to create a new corporate logo or trademark for use throughout the company. A 1968 memoranda to James Linen titled "The Need for a World-Wide Identity Program" lists the variety of marks used by Time Inc. and its subsidiaries and describes his proposed project to create a cohesive corporate identity for the company. Files include samples of proposed logo designs on letterhead, envelopes, business cards and the corporate jet; correspondence and memoranda discussing the need for corporate design, design requirements, and trademarks of other companies; and a collection of other companies annual reports and other materials. Notes found with the loose material indicate these are Harding's materials and some materials were sent by Louis Slovinsky, possibly meaning that Harding worked with the corporate publicity office on this project.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation Note
prefercite.p: This collection should be cited as Time Inc. Harry Harding Files on Corporate Identity, MS 3009-RG 42, New-York Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information Note
processinfo.p: The Harry Harding Files on Corporate Identity were processed by Holly Deakyne in March 2018. The original folders were retained although some loose documents were newly housed in archival containers. Arrangement was imposed. Deakyne created the inventory and other descriptive notes to produce this finding aid.
